alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Spartanburg; Union; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 03 at 7:21PM EST until March 03 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern York County in Upstate South Carolina... East central Spartanburg County in Upstate South Carolina... Southern Cherokee County in Upstate South Carolina... Northeastern Union County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 800 PM EST. * At 721 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles east of Spartanburg, or near Cedar Springs, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Pacolet, Pacolet Mills, Sharon, Hickory Grove, Smyrna, Croft State Park, Cedar Springs, Bullock Creek, Thicketty and Saratt. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for Upstate South Carolina. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A few trees may be blown down near the path of this storm. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
